intro: Bossiaea laxa, commonly known as the slender bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Bossiaea laxa is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
